definition: hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: It's a paradox that Hot Money rushed in online game industry.
sentences.chinese: 热钱涌入网游行业，这是一个矛盾的话题。

sentences.english: Hot money is notoriously unstable and even more notoriously procyclical.
sentences.chinese: 热钱素有不稳定的恶名，名声更差的是其顺周期性。

sentences.english: Hot money is flowing into the share market at the moment.

sentences.chinese: 密切监控跨境资本流动，防范“热钱”流入。

sentences.english: Second, what is China's position on hot money?

sentences.chinese: 那么，积债累累的相关国家必得依赖热钱。

sentences.english: Hot money inflows will see major re-allocations due to the US ratings downgrade.
sentences.chinese: 美国主权信用评级的下调令部分国际热钱转移。

sentences.english: The two favoured destinations for now-skittish capital are Japan and America.
sentences.chinese: 热钱现在最好的2个目标国家就是日本和美国。

sentences.english: When the financial crisis struck, this "hot money" quickly left the state.
sentences.chinese: 不过金融危机爆发后，高息存款这笔热钱迅速抽逃。
